story_title: Ancient Greek Device Predicted the Cosmos
original_story: [excited] Get this! In 1901, divers off the coast of Antikythera discovered an ancient Greek treasure—a complex 2,000-year-old device! This ingenious mechanism, often called the first analog computer, was used to predict astronomical positions and eclipses. Crafted around the 2nd century BCE, it had over 30 gears, working together like a clock. This astounding technology reveals how advanced Greek civilization was! Imagine navigating the stars with this marvel—it's like ancient GPS! Can you believe they mastered such precision so long ago?
